text: I did a thing! Listen to @scottbraddock, @RyanPoppe1 and me on this week's @HoustonChron Texas Take podcast as we dissect Lt. Gov. @DanPatrick new tune, the $$$ @BetoORourke is raising and the future of red light cameras and teacher pay raises. https://www.houstonchronicle.com/politics/texas-take/texas-take-podcast/article/Listen-A-new-Dan-Patrick-And-money-for-Beto-13709802.php … #txlege
author: andreazelinski

text: And after calling everyone in this room leaders and praising their public service, @DanPatrick is a wrap. #txlege
author: andreazelinski

text: .@DanPatrick is now turning to immigration, says "we cannot afford to Medicaid and educate... the whole world." #txlege
author: andreazelinski

text: .@DanPatrick: some schools in Texas are "failing factories," he says as he makes the case for school finance reform. #txlege.
author: andreazelinski

text: .@DanPatrick is staying firm that they #txlege needs to give across-the-board raises for all teachers. As I mentioned earlier, the House is not into that at this point. #txlege
author: andreazelinski

text: .@DanPatrick says they're going to put some "bonus money" in their school finance plan. It's unclear if he means the $5,000 raises they already passed or a bonus for teachers moving to struggling schools. #txlege
author: andreazelinski

text: .@DanPatrick: We're all going to have to give a little so the people feel like we're listening to them.  #txlege
author: andreazelinski

text: .@DanPatrick says he and the speaker and the governor made a pact to not snipe at each other in the media, or out to "where the media can rip us up." #txlege
author: andreazelinski

text: .@DanPatrick floats the idea of raising the sales tax and using that money for schools. Doesn't sound opposed. #txlege
author: andreazelinski

text: @danpatrick suggests he's not positive lawmakers will get school finance and property taxes done by the end of the legislative session. "I want to leave session, whenever that is... I don't want to pass a shiny bill to get out of dodge." #txlege
author: andreazelinski

text: .@DanPatrick: "We're always asked to do more but there's a limit to what we have" in revenue to spend in the budget. Makes the case to lower property taxes. #txlege
author: andreazelinski

text: .@DanPatrick makes the case that Republicans have put the state on a positive path, saved money, attracted businesses and needs to keep them here. #txlege
author: andreazelinski

text: .@DanPatrick: "We're a nation. We're not just the state... We're larger than Russia... We've created more jobs than most of the other states combined over the last decade." #txkege
author: andreazelinski

text: .@DanPatrick: "You can agree to disagree without being disagreeable."  #txlege
author: andreazelinski

text: .@DanPatrick uses a softer hand referencing former House Speaker @SpeakerStraus in commenting that the House now has a new speaker now. Interesting considering he used Straus as a punching bag last session. #txlege
author: andreazelinski

text: Patrick: We have a crisis with property taxes. We have a crisis with our school finance system. We have a crisis with keeping teachers. We have a crisis on the border. #txlege
author: andreazelinski

text: .@DanPatrick says he's "privileged" to work with all 31 members of the Senate, including the Democrats. No tongue-in-cheek tone here. #txlege
author: andreazelinski

text: Lt. Gov. @DanPatrick is about to speak to the New Braunfels Chamber of Commerce's Legislative Conference. #txlege
author: andreazelinski

text: The House plan inserts more than $6B into education, and the architects of the bill expect a lot of that $$ will go into pay raises for teachers and staff -- but there's no specs on how that would get spread out except to lure teachers to move to struggling schools. #txlege
author: andreazelinski

text: .@KirkPWatson says he's proud the Senate voted unamiously for a $5,000 across-the-board raise for teachers and librarians. This required raise is not in the big House education bill, and that could be a a sticking point between the two chambers. #txlege
author: andreazelinski

text: While that proposal is probably pie-in-the sky, the talk now is about how to find new revenue to support the state contributing more to education. Here are a few options #txlege is kicking around.
author: andreazelinski

text: "You have to control school taxes to get property tax relief," says @TeamBettencourt. Amid talk about requiring TX pay 50% of school operating expenses, @rossramsey jokes it would cost a "kabillion dollars." What it would really cost: $22,925,794,320. Lots of commas there #txlege
author: andreazelinski

text: Good question from moderator @rossramsey: are you going to cut property taxes? This is key: lawmakers are going to want to go home telling people they lowered their property taxes, but the current big proposal would only slow the rate of growth. #txlege
author: andreazelinski

text: I'm at the New Braunfels Chamber of Commerce Legislative Conference listening to Sens. @TeamBettencourt and @KirkPWatson talk property taxes and school finance. #txlege
